input_text:
Job Title: Student Experience Specialist

Location: United States

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Education, Training

Description:
The salary range for this role takes into account the wide range of factors that are considered in making compensation decisions including but not limited to skill sets; experience and training; licensure and certifications; and other business and organizational needs.

At WGU, it is not typical for an individual to be hired at or near the top of the range for their role, and compensation decisions are dependent on the facts and circumstances of each case. A reasonable estimate of the current range is:

Pay Range: $58,000.00 - $87,000.00

If you’re passionate about building a better future for individuals, communities, and our country—and you’re committed to working hard to play your part in building that future—consider WGU as the next step in your career.

Driven by a mission to expand access to higher education through online, competency-based degree programs, WGU is also committed to being a great place to work for a diverse workforce of student-focused professionals. The university has pioneered a new way to learn in the 21st century, one that has received praise from academic, industry, government, and media leaders. Whatever your role, working for WGU gives you a part to play in helping students graduate, creating a better tomorrow for themselves and their families.

Essential Functions and Responsibilities: 

Fosters student progress through observation of student behaviors, incoming support requests, and student-identified challenges and develops resources or new interventions to eliminate barriers and improve the student experience. Serve as a key contributor to increasing student retention and graduation through planning, organizing and conducting outreach strategies to aid students in their academic progress.Provides WGU Academy and program level expertise to students via direct student outreach and responding to support requests. Maintains that expertise through ongoing development activities (such as staying up to date on policies, program updates, and technology/platform changes.)Cross collaborates with other professionals within the Academy to identify opportunities for improvements to processes and student-facing resources or course materials and promotes a positive, student-obsessed atmosphere. Responds to student questions and concerns through managing incoming support requests; resolves complex student issues, directly supporting students and owning the issue from start to finish; takes efforts to ensure ongoing satisfaction with the program and successful progress to completion.Drives student engagement in 1-1 coaching sessions with their assigned Student Success Coach through outreach and motivational communication practices via phone and email.Demonstrates a commitment to diversity, equity, and inclusion, and supports a culture of inclusivity and belonging.Consistently exhibits WGU Leadership Principles.Performs other related duties as assigned.

Knowledge, Skill and Abilities:

Fosters student progress through observation of student behaviors, incoming support requests, and student-identified challenges and develops resources or new interventions to eliminate barriers and improve the student experience. Serve as a key contributor to increasing student retention and graduation through planning, organizing and conducting outreach strategies to aid students in their academic progress.Provides WGU Academy and program level expertise to students via direct student outreach and responding to support requests. Maintains that expertise through ongoing development activities (such as staying up to date on policies, program updates, and technology/platform changes.)Cross collaborates with other professionals within the Academy to identify opportunities for improvements to processes and student-facing resources or course materials and promotes a positive, student-obsessed atmosphere. Responds to student questions and concerns through managing incoming support requests; resolves complex student issues, directly supporting students and owning the issue from start to finish; takes efforts to ensure ongoing satisfaction with the program and successful progress to completion.Drives student engagement in 1-1 coaching sessions with their assigned Student Success Coach through outreach and motivational communication practices via phone and email.Demonstrates a commitment to diversity, equity, and inclusion, and supports a culture of inclusivity and belonging.Consistently exhibits WGU Leadership Principles.Performs other related duties as assigned.

Job Qualifications:

Minimum Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree required, in educational background, business, communication or related field.At least 2+ years of experience working in education, non-profit organizations, or underserved populations.Experience in a student-facing or customer-facing role.Proficient in Salesforce and Microsoft Office Suite with an emphasis in Outlook and Excel.Demonstrated experience in working independently with little supervision.

Preferred Qualifications:

Experience with distance education and distance learning students is preferred.Coaching experience preferred.Current WGU employees must submit their internal application prior to 4/30/2024 to be considered for this position*

Disclaimer: This Job Description has been designed to indicate the general nature, essential duties, and responsibilities of work performed by employees within this classification. It does not contain a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities, and qualifications that are required of the employee to do this job. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without notice. This Job Description does not constitute a contract of employment and the University may exercise its employment-at-will rights at any time.

As an equal opportunity employer, WGU recognizes that our strength lies in our people. We are committed to diversity.

Experience Level (if available): Internship

output_json.title: Student Experience Specialist
output_json.summary: WGU is seeking a Student Experience Specialist to foster student progress and improve the student experience.
job_responsibilities: Observes student behaviors and incoming support requests to develop resources or new interventions to eliminate barriers and improve the student experience.
Contributes to increasing student retention and graduation through planning, organizing, and conducting outreach strategies.
Provides WGU Academy and program level expertise to students via direct student outreach and responds to support requests.
Maintains expertise through ongoing development activities such as staying updated on policies, program updates, and technology/platform changes.
Collaborates with other professionals within the Academy to identify opportunities for process improvements and student-facing resources or course materials.
Responds to student questions and concerns through managing incoming support requests, resolving complex student issues, and ensuring ongoing satisfaction with the program.
Drives student engagement in 1-1 coaching sessions with their assigned Student Success Coach.
Demonstrates a commitment to diversity, equity, and inclusion.
output_json.company_information: WGU is an online, competency-based university that provides access to higher education through online degree programs.
output_json.equal_opportunity_policy: WGU is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity.

other.content:
Minimum Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree required, in educational background, business, communication or related field. At least 2+ years of experience working in education, non-profit organizations, or underserved populations. Experience in a student-facing or customer-facing role. Proficient in Salesforce and Microsoft Office Suite with an emphasis in Outlook and Excel. Demonstrated experience in working independently with little supervision.

Preferred Qualifications: Experience with distance education and distance learning students is preferred. Coaching experience preferred. Current WGU employees must submit their internal application prior to 4/30/2024 to be considered for this position*

This Job Description has been designed to indicate the general nature, essential duties, and responsibilities of work performed by employees within this classification. It does not contain a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities, and qualifications that are required of the employee to do this job. Duties, responsibilities, and activities may change at any time with or without notice. This Job Description does not constitute a contract of employment and the University may exercise its employment-at-will rights at any time.
